99199767.review:
This little gem was gifted to me by a friend and was a short but sweet game that is like an interactive visual novel.  The story itself is not remarkable, it has parts that are familiar to probably anyone who plays it. I know I found myself familiar with aspects of the main character, Florence, and her experiences with the routine, the mundane, first love and hardships. 

The game itself revolves around conversations and not so much puzzles. There is no collecting and exploration. You don't  have any bearing on the story or its direction, your more a spectator watching Florence's life and interacting in her actions more than influencing anything. But this is not a negative. You are experiencing her life as she transitions through it. 

The artwork is charming, I especially love some of the more romantic scenes depicted of Florence and her boyfriend Krish. I was rooting for them till the end and well the story did have a happy ending of sorts, just not the one I was expecting. 

So positives-strong emotional story, great music, and great art style. The negatives are the length and minimalist game play for some if your more about the action than the story. ❤️

Es un juego sencillo pero emotivo, la  música encaja con cada situación y te hace vivirlo. Sencillamente es un gran trabajo. Terminas llorando pero con una sonrisa, ella es feliz, me gusta.

99128929.review: A short but delightful game about love and life. Very much in the wheelhouse of other Annapurna published games, this doesn't have very much in the way of traditional games but it crafts its mechanics with purpose. Every touch you do in this game is in service of what it's trying to tell you and I think it is one of the best experiences I have ever had in utilizing the elements of storytelling unique to the video game genre in service of the story it is trying to tell you. Definitely pick it up if you are at all interested in more "Artsy" games. I finished it in under an hour but I loved every minute of it and it also doesn't cost all that much, especially on sale. Also some pretty cello/piano tunes in here that do fit the tone quite well.

It's short. 40 minutes. I feel like it could've been longer. But no matter: it's yet another example of galaxy brain usage of game medium to the fullest as a storytelling tool. While big publishers push for cinematic experiences that try to turn games into movies, this is a game - and it tells a story via its gameplay.

It's a little hard to explain without spoiling. Ever read a poem that really resonated with you and you couldn't really explain why? This is kinda like this. It feels like direct emotion is transferred between the developer's heart and yours. That's the best I got. 

Just get it, there are far worse ways to spend 40 minutes.

98292120.review:
[h1]Comentario Robótico-Analítico: "Florence"[/h1]

Florence es una obra muy breve pero cautivadora. Hace uso de una mecánica con carácter de comic interactivo mezclada con puzles muy sencillos pero comunicativos que, con la cantidad justa de texto, manifiesta el significado de cada escena de manera simbólica. Así mismo su selección musical y diseño artístico aportan a una obra personal y emotiva cuyo rumbo es predecible y no muy original, pero que sabe cautivar gracias a lo mágica que es la suma de sus partes.

[b]La rutina es otra forma de morir.[/b]

Hace tiempo un amigo me dijo esta frase, "la rutina es otra forma de morir". Desconozco de su origen, pero su significado es bastante. La rutina es el principio de muchos contratiempos, y en esta historia causó la muerte de "algo", quizá el mensaje de Florence pasa por ahí.

[b]¿En conclusión?[/b] Un juego bonito y muy disfrutable. No es brillante, pero cumple con lo que promete.

97605575.review:
[h1]La aventura de Florence[/h1]
Florence es una especie de experiencia grafica como muchas de las que hay hoy día en Steam. Una especie de historia interactiva sin ningún tipo de final alternativo.

El argumento es un poco simple y repetido en todo tipo de películas. Habla de las diferentes fases de una pareja: pasión, amor, rutina.....Pero la verdad es que lo refleja muy bien.

Lo mejor del juego son las cuidadas ilustraciones y la banda sonora de violonchelo

Lo malo es lo poco rejugable que es y que podrían haberle dado más profundidad a la historia (como un final alternativo o consecuencias a los actos (por ejemplo no contestar a tu madre o con lo de sacar la mudanza algún tipo de discusión y cosas así))
La aventura por decirlo así se pasa en 1 hora que para menos de 4€ esta bien para echar un rato.

[b]Lo bueno[/b]
✔️El Arte grafico.
✔️La música.
✔️Algún que otra acción original dentro del juego.

[b]Lo malo[/b]
❌La duración.
❌Lo poco rejugable que es.
❌Poca profundidad en la historia.

Nota: [b]7/10[/b]

97281266.review:
It's beautiful.
Florence presents a relatively simple story in such a beautiful and immersive way. 
The blend of immaculate art and music along with gameplay that reflects moments in the story creates a gripping experience that is unforgettable.
The game pulls you in and takes you on an emotional ride that had me playing start to finish in 1 sitting.
The structure of the puzzles and gameplay themselves is phenomenal as it actually impacts your perception of the game, and the way in which the game plays out visually and audibly  in the gameplay all comes  together to really set the scene for the players mind. 

If you like narrative games, this is just amazing. I have no complaints really, even when things are unclear its done for a purpose, to poke at the player and help them understand. 

10/10- a masterpiece of game storytelling
